verses.kjv: But Solomon was building his own house thirteen years, and he finished all his house.
verses.ct: Solomon spent 13 years constructing his own palace, and eventually completed the entire complex.

verses.kjv: He built also the house of the forest of Lebanon; the length thereof was an hundred cubits, and the breadth thereof fifty cubits, and the height thereof thirty cubits, upon four rows of cedar pillars, with cedar beams upon the pillars.
verses.ct: He also built the Palace of the Forest of Lebanon. It was 150 feet long, 75 feet wide, and 45 feet tall, supported by 4 rows of cedar columns with cedar beams resting on top of them.

verses.kjv: And it was covered with cedar above upon the beams, that lay on forty five pillars, fifteen in a row.
verses.ct: Cedar planking covered the structure above the beams, which rested on 45 columns — 15 in each row.

verses.kjv: And there were windows in three rows, and light was against light in three ranks.
verses.ct: There were 3 rows of windows, with each window directly facing another window on the opposite side, in 3 tiers.

verses.kjv: And all the doors and posts were square, with the windows: and light was against light in three ranks.
verses.ct: All the doorways and window frames were rectangular, and the windows faced each other in 3 tiers.

verses.kjv: And he made a porch of pillars; the length thereof was fifty cubits, and the breadth thereof thirty cubits: and the porch was before them: and the other pillars and the thick beam were before them.
verses.ct: He constructed a colonnade that was 75 feet long and 45 feet wide. In front of it was a covered porch with columns and a canopy.

verses.kjv: Then he made a porch for the throne where he might judge, even the porch of judgment: and it was covered with cedar from one side of the floor to the other.
verses.ct: Then he built the Hall of the Throne where he would serve as judge — the Hall of Justice. It was lined with cedar from floor to ceiling.

verses.kjv: And his house where he dwelt had another court within the porch, which was of the like work. Solomon made also an house for Pharaoh’s daughter, whom he had taken to wife, like unto this porch.
verses.ct: His personal residence was in a separate courtyard behind the Hall, built in the same style. Solomon also constructed a palace just like this hall for Pharaoh's daughter, whom he had married.

verses.kjv: All these were of costly stones, according to the measures of hewed stones, sawed with saws, within and without, even from the foundation unto the coping, and so on the outside toward the great court.
verses.ct: All of these structures were made with expensive cut stone, precisely measured and sawed on every side, from the foundations all the way up to the eaves, and extending outward to the large courtyard.

verses.kjv: And the foundation was of costly stones, even great stones, stones of ten cubits, and stones of eight cubits.
verses.ct: The foundations were laid with massive, expensive stones — some 15 feet long and others 12 feet long.

verses.kjv: And above were costly stones, after the measures of hewed stones, and cedars.
verses.ct: Above the foundations were more expensive stones, cut to precise measurements, along with cedar timbers.

verses.kjv: And the great court round about was with three rows of hewed stones, and a row of cedar beams, both for the inner court of the house of the LORD, and for the porch of the house.
verses.ct: The large courtyard all around was enclosed by 3 courses of cut stone topped with a layer of cedar beams, matching the design of both the inner courtyard of the LORD's temple and the temple's entrance hall.

verses.kjv: And king Solomon sent and fetched Hiram out of Tyre.
verses.ct: King Solomon sent for a man named Hiram from Tyre and brought him to Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: He was a widow’s son of the tribe of Naphtali, and his father was a man of Tyre, a worker in brass: and he was filled with wisdom, and understanding, and cunning to work all works in brass. And he came to king Solomon, and wrought all his work.
verses.ct: Hiram's mother was a widow from the tribe of Naphtali, and his father had been a man from Tyre who worked with bronze. Hiram was extremely skilled, knowledgeable, and talented in every kind of bronze work. He came to King Solomon and carried out all the metalwork.

verses.kjv: For he cast two pillars of brass, of eighteen cubits high apiece: and a line of twelve cubits did compass either of them about.
verses.ct: He cast 2 bronze pillars, each 27 feet tall, and each measuring 18 feet in circumference.

verses.kjv: And he made two chapiters of molten brass, to set upon the tops of the pillars: the height of the one chapiter was five cubits, and the height of the other chapiter was five cubits:
verses.ct: He also made 2 capitals out of cast bronze to place on top of the pillars. Each capital was 7 and a half feet tall.

verses.kjv: And nets of checker work, and wreaths of chain work, for the chapiters which were upon the top of the pillars; seven for the one chapiter, and seven for the other chapiter.
verses.ct: The capitals on top of the pillars were decorated with lattice networks and woven chain designs — 7 sets of chains for each capital.

verses.kjv: And he made the pillars, and two rows round about upon the one network, to cover the chapiters that were upon the top, with pomegranates: and so did he for the other chapiter.
verses.ct: He also made rows of pomegranate decorations — 2 rows encircling each network — to cover the capitals on top of the pillars. He did the same for both capitals.

verses.kjv: And the chapiters that were upon the top of the pillars were of lily work in the porch, four cubits.
verses.ct: The capitals on top of the pillars in the entrance hall were shaped like lilies, standing 6 feet tall.

verses.kjv: And the chapiters upon the two pillars had pomegranates also above, over against the belly which was by the network: and the pomegranates were two hundred in rows round about upon the other chapiter.
verses.ct: On both capitals, above the rounded section next to the network, there were also pomegranates — 200 in rows all the way around each capital.

verses.kjv: And he set up the pillars in the porch of the temple: and he set up the right pillar, and called the name thereof Jachin: and he set up the left pillar, and called the name thereof Boaz.
verses.ct: He erected the pillars at the entrance of the temple. He placed the right pillar and named it Jachin, then placed the left pillar and named it Boaz.

verses.kjv: And upon the top of the pillars was lily work: so was the work of the pillars finished.
verses.ct: The tops of the pillars were decorated with lily designs. With that, the work on the pillars was complete.

verses.kjv: And he made a molten sea, ten cubits from the one brim to the other: it was round all about, and his height was five cubits: and a line of thirty cubits did compass it round about.
verses.ct: Then he made a large circular basin of cast metal called "the Sea." It measured 15 feet from rim to rim, stood 7 and a half feet tall, and was 45 feet in circumference.

verses.kjv: And under the brim of it round about there were knops compassing it, ten in a cubit, compassing the sea round about: the knops were cast in two rows, when it was cast.
verses.ct: Below the rim, decorative gourds encircled it — 10 per foot and a half — running all the way around. The gourds were cast in 2 rows as part of the original casting.

verses.kjv: It stood upon twelve oxen, three looking toward the north, and three looking toward the west, and three looking toward the south, and three looking toward the east: and the sea was set above upon them, and all their hinder parts were inward.
verses.ct: The Sea rested on 12 bronze oxen: 3 facing north, 3 facing west, 3 facing south, and 3 facing east. The basin sat on top of them, and all their hindquarters faced inward.

verses.kjv: And it was an hand breadth thick, and the brim thereof was wrought like the brim of a cup, with flowers of lilies: it contained two thousand baths.
verses.ct: The basin was about 3 inches thick, and its rim was shaped like the rim of a cup, curving outward like a lily blossom. It could hold about 12,000 gallons.

verses.kjv: And he made ten bases of brass; four cubits was the length of one base, and four cubits the breadth thereof, and three cubits the height of it.
verses.ct: He also made 10 bronze stands, each 6 feet long, 6 feet wide, and 4 and a half feet tall.

verses.kjv: And the work of the bases was on this manner: they had borders, and the borders were between the ledges:
verses.ct: The stands were constructed with panels set between upright frames.

verses.kjv: And on the borders that were between the ledges were lions, oxen, and cherubims: and upon the ledges there was a base above: and beneath the lions and oxen were certain additions made of thin work.
verses.ct: On the panels between the frames were images of lions, oxen, and cherubim. Above and below the lions and oxen on the frames were wreath designs made of hammered metalwork.

verses.kjv: And every base had four brasen wheels, and plates of brass: and the four corners thereof had undersetters: under the laver were undersetters molten, at the side of every addition.
verses.ct: Each stand had 4 bronze wheels with bronze axles. At the 4 corners were cast supports beneath the basin, with decorative wreaths on each side.

verses.kjv: And the mouth of it within the chapiter and above was a cubit: but the mouth thereof was round after the work of the base, a cubit and an half: and also upon the mouth of it were gravings with their borders, foursquare, not round.
verses.ct: The opening inside the crown-shaped top extended up about 18 inches. The opening itself was round, fitting the design of the stand, measuring about 27 inches across. Engravings decorated the area around the opening, though the panels were square, not round.

verses.kjv: And under the borders were four wheels; and the axletrees of the wheels were joined to the base: and the height of a wheel was a cubit and half a cubit.
verses.ct: The 4 wheels were underneath the panels, and the axles were attached to the stand. Each wheel was about 27 inches tall.

verses.kjv: And the work of the wheels was like the work of a chariot wheel: their axletrees, and their naves, and their felloes, and their spokes, were all molten.
verses.ct: The wheels were built like chariot wheels — their axles, rims, spokes, and hubs were all cast in bronze.

verses.kjv: And there were four undersetters to the four corners of one base: and the undersetters were of the very base itself.
verses.ct: There were 4 supports at the 4 corners of each stand, formed as one piece with the stand itself.

verses.kjv: And in the top of the base was there a round compass of half a cubit high: and on the top of the base the ledges thereof and the borders thereof were of the same.
verses.ct: At the top of each stand was a circular band about 9 inches high, with the supports and panels attached as part of the same piece.

verses.kjv: For on the plates of the ledges thereof, and on the borders thereof, he graved cherubims, lions, and palm trees, according to the proportion of every one, and additions round about.
verses.ct: On the surfaces of the supports and panels, he engraved cherubim, lions, and palm trees wherever there was space, with wreaths all around.

verses.kjv: After this manner he made the ten bases: all of them had one casting, one measure, and one size.
verses.ct: This is how he made all 10 stands. They were all identical — cast from the same mold, with the same dimensions and the same design.

verses.kjv: Then made he ten lavers of brass: one laver contained forty baths: and every laver was four cubits: and upon every one of the ten bases one laver.
verses.ct: Then he made 10 bronze basins, one for each stand. Each basin held about 240 gallons and measured 6 feet across.

verses.kjv: And he put five bases on the right side of the house, and five on the left side of the house: and he set the sea on the right side of the house eastward over against the south.
verses.ct: He positioned 5 stands on the south side of the temple and 5 on the north side. The Sea was placed at the southeast corner of the temple.

verses.kjv: And Hiram made the lavers, and the shovels, and the basons. So Hiram made an end of doing all the work that he made king Solomon for the house of the LORD:
verses.ct: Hiram also made the pots, shovels, and sprinkling bowls. With that, Hiram finished all the work he had been doing for King Solomon on the LORD's temple:

verses.kjv: The two pillars, and the two bowls of the chapiters that were on the top of the two pillars; and the two networks, to cover the two bowls of the chapiters which were upon the top of the pillars;
verses.ct: the 2 pillars; the 2 bowl-shaped capitals on top of the pillars; the 2 sets of network covering the bowl-shaped capitals on top of the pillars;

verses.kjv: And four hundred pomegranates for the two networks, even two rows of pomegranates for one network, to cover the two bowls of the chapiters that were upon the pillars;
verses.ct: the 400 pomegranates for the 2 networks — 2 rows of pomegranates for each network, covering the bowl-shaped capitals on top of the pillars;

verses.kjv: And the ten bases, and ten lavers on the bases;
verses.ct: the 10 stands with their 10 basins;

verses.kjv: And one sea, and twelve oxen under the sea;
verses.ct: the Sea with the 12 oxen beneath it;

verses.kjv: And the pots, and the shovels, and the basons: and all these vessels, which Hiram made to king Solomon for the house of the LORD, were of bright brass.
verses.ct: and the pots, shovels, and sprinkling bowls. All these items that Hiram crafted for King Solomon for the LORD's temple were made of polished bronze.

verses.kjv: In the plain of Jordan did the king cast them, in the clay ground between Succoth and Zarthan.
verses.ct: The king had them cast in clay molds in the Jordan Valley, in the area between Succoth and Zarthan.

verses.kjv: And Solomon left all the vessels unweighed, because they were exceeding many: neither was the weight of the brass found out.
verses.ct: Solomon never had any of these items weighed because there were so many of them. The total weight of the bronze was never calculated.

verses.kjv: And Solomon made all the vessels that pertained unto the house of the LORD: the altar of gold, and the table of gold, whereupon the shewbread was,
verses.ct: Solomon also made all the furnishings for the LORD's temple: the gold altar, the gold table where the sacred bread was displayed,

verses.kjv: And the candlesticks of pure gold, five on the right side, and five on the left, before the oracle, with the flowers, and the lamps, and the tongs of gold,
verses.ct: the lampstands of pure gold — 5 on the right side and 5 on the left side in front of the inner sanctuary — along with the gold flower decorations, lamps, and tongs,

verses.kjv: And the bowls, and the snuffers, and the basons, and the spoons, and the censers of pure gold; and the hinges of gold, both for the doors of the inner house, the most holy place, and for the doors of the house, to wit, of the temple.
verses.ct: the bowls, wick trimmers, sprinkling bowls, dishes, and incense burners of pure gold, and the gold hinges for the doors of the innermost room (the Most Holy Place) and for the doors of the main hall of the temple.

verses.kjv: So was ended all the work that king Solomon made for the house of the LORD. And Solomon brought in the things which David his father had dedicated; even the silver, and the gold, and the vessels, did he put among the treasures of the house of the LORD.
verses.ct: When all the work King Solomon had done for the LORD's temple was finished, he brought in the items his father David had dedicated — the silver, the gold, and the various articles — and placed them in the treasuries of the LORD's temple.
